title: The Rothschilds' heavy name
summary: 'Successions,' season 3' (4/6). Personal rivalries and business conflicts have often strained relations between the different branches of this banking family whose history spans several centuries.

title: US presidential election: Kamala Harris rolls out the blue carpet for influencers
summary: The Democratic Party has offered unprecedented accreditation to 200 content creators to cover the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, a first that testifies to their growing place in political communication strategies.

title: Paralympic Games: What we know about the opening ceremony
summary: 4,400 para-athletes will descend the Avenue des Champs-Elysées in a 'people's parade' on Wednesday, August 28. Choreographed by Sweden's Alexander Ekman, the ceremony will continue on the Place de la Concorde.

title: Biden presses Netanyahu on Gaza deal as talks stumble –meanwhile, Israeli military kills senior Palestinian militant
summary: The US and Israeli leaders spoke after US Secretary of State Anthony Blinken ended a tour of the Middle East aimed at reaching an accord as tensions rise in the region. Meanwhile, the Israeli military killed a senior Palestinian militant in Lebanon on Wednesday, Khalil Maqdah, described by Fatah as 'one of the leaders' of its armed wing in Lebanon, just hours after Blinken's return.

title: Central bankers' independence is under growing political pressure
summary: The world's leading central bankers are gathering for three days in Jackson Hole, Wyoming, for the Fed's traditional annual symposium.

title: In retaliation for possible taxation of its electric vehicles, China launches anti-dumping investigation into EU dairy products
summary: China's Ministry of Commerce will examine possible European anti-competitive practices concerning fresh cheese, blue cheese and other dairy specialties. Beijing has already targeted pork and spirits.

title: The Mexican president passes the torch to his successor during a triumphant tour: 'So much love' from the people
summary: Andrés Manuel López Obrador and the president-elect Claudia Sheinbaum toured Mexico's 32 states together over the summer. This marathon of events ended on Sunday in Monterrey, in the country's industrial north.

title: Trump holds first outdoor rally since assassination attempt, speaks behind bulletproof glass
summary: A bulletproof screen could be seen around the podium where Trump and his vice presidential pick, J.D. Vance, addressed the crowd in Asheboro, North Carolina on Wednesday. At one point during his speech, Trump left the stage and entered the crowd to check on an attendee who was suffering a medical issue.

title: US presidential election: With Harris, Democrats take back banner of freedom from Republicans
summary: The two parties are engaged in an ideological and political battle over this cardinal American value, long confiscated by conservatives, but with which the Democratic candidate wants to reconcile the progressive camp.

title: The mpox vaccine response, an industrial and diplomatic challenge
summary: The African continent, the epicenter of the epidemic, is hoping to receive the first deliveries of the vaccine manufactured in Denmark.

title: At Nice Jazz Fest, rapper Nas celebrates a career spanning 30 years
summary: Moved to the end of August because of the Paris Olympics, this increasingly eclectic festival welcomed the son of trumpeter Olu Dara for its opening night.

title: Altice: Executive dismissed during corruption scandal sues company
summary: Dismissed on August 2, 2023, a few days after the start of the Pereira scandal, Tatiana Agova-Bregou is contesting an 'abusive' and 'vexing' dismissal.

title: Israel kills Fatah commander in Lebanon strike
summary: Khalil al-Maqdah was killed in a strike on his car in the southern Lebanese city of Sidon, according to Fatah and a Lebanese security source.

title: France's outgoing prime minister proposes spending freeze in 2025
summary: Documents sent out to ministries by Gabriel Attal on Tuesday plan for a budget similar to this year's. But it will be up to the future government to formally approve it or not.

title: At the Democratic convention, the Obamas portray Harris as the American dream's embodiment
summary: Barack and Michelle Obama, as well as the presidential candidate's husband, Doug Emhoff, appeared on the second day of the Democratic National Convention. Kamala Harris was officially nominated.

title: Imran Khan applies from prison to be chancellor of Oxford University
summary: The former prime minister, who has been in prison for a year, fears being court-martialed.

title: French left prepares its own 2025 budget
summary: MPs in the Nouveau Front Populaire left-wing alliance are preparing a draft budget, in case the coalition is called upon to form a government. It includes a targeted investment and infrastructure plan that could reach €10 billion.

title: France undermining Kanak rights in restive New Caledonia, say UN experts
summary: According to UN special rapporteurs, the bill in question 'threatens to dismantle other achievements of the Nouméa Accord relating to the recognition of the Kanak Indigenous identity, Kanak customary institutions as well as customary law and land rights.'

title: Iran's hard-line parliament approves all members of president's cabinet
summary: This is the first time in over two decades a leader has been able to get all of his officials through the body. It includes the first female minister in over a decade.

title: Bill Clinton returns to DNC to praise Harris and tear into Trump: 'He mostly talks about himself'
summary: The nation’s 42nd president, who gave an emblematic, off-the-cuff address on Wednesday, said he has been at every Democratic National Convention since 1972.

title: Russian oligarch Mikhail Fridman claims €14.5 billion from Luxembourg
summary: Targeted by sanctions imposed by the 27 member states but cleared by the European courts, the head of Alfa Group wants to recover his assets. Nevertheless, they remain frozen.

title: Alain Delon's funeral set for Saturday
summary: The famed actor had asked to be buried at his property in Douchy-Montcorbon, a village in central France.

title: Taylor Swift says she's filled with 'fear,' 'guilt' after Vienna terror threat
summary: The main suspect, a 19-year-old Austrian with North Macedonian roots, had allegedly confessed, saying he 'intended to carry out an attack using explosives and knives,' according to Austrian domestic intelligence agency (DSN) head Omar Haijawi-Pirchner.

title: What we know about mpox: Transmission, dangerosity, who's at risk
summary: Here are six questions to better understand this disease, which was deemed a public health emergency of international concern by the WHO.

title: VP pick Tim Walz lauds Kamala Harris at Democratic convention
summary: In a whirlwind quarter-hour address, the Minnesota governor raced through the story of his middle-class upbringing in small town Nebraska and described his experience teaching students who inspired him to go into politics.

title: Anti-Trump Republicans are VIP guests at Democratic convention
summary: Geoff Duncan, former lieutenant-governor of Georgia, said his party had become 'a cult worshipping a felonious thug' while former White House spokeswoman Stephanie Grisham told the convention 'I love my country more than my party.'

title: International Criminal Court faces constant pressure over Gaza and Israel
summary: To prevent the issuing of arrest warrants against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, Israel, along with several Western countries, has stepped up efforts to paralyze the Court.

title: 'Suspicions of forced labor and lack of transparency could complicate matters for Shein'
summary: Legal expert Isabelle Feng observes that changes in US and European regulations on postal charges, taxes and social rights threaten the business model of the Chinese fast-fashion platform.

title: In Pakistan's Balochistan region, families of victims of repression demand justice
summary: After security forces violently quelled a demonstration by nationalists in this troubled area of southwestern Pakistan, the families of victims of enforced disappearances have, since mid-August, been putting their anger on display.

title: 'Obama from the Seine' emerges as option to be next French prime minister
summary: Among the names swirling as potential picks to become the new prime minister, Karim Bouamrane, the Socialist mayor of the Paris suburb of Saint-Ouen, has gained traction. He is a critic of his party's radical allies, La France Insoumise.

title: Authenticity of 'America's coach' Tim Walz takes center stage at Democratic convention
summary: Kamala Harris's running mate accepted the party's nomination on Wednesday, in a speech emphasizing the values of rural America.

title: Lana Del Rey's sophisticated melancholy opens Rock en Seine
summary: The festival in near Paris, running until August 25, welcomed the American singer on Wednesday for the only French date of her six concerts in Europe.

title: Putin makes oblique references to Ukrainian incursion on tour of Russian Caucasus
summary: The Russian president made visits to North Ossetia and Chechnya, where he had not set foot for 13 years, making indirect references in speeches to the front opened by the Ukrainians at Kursk.

title: French court dismisses appeal in Agent Orange case
summary: Tran To Nga, who was born in what was then French Indochina, accused 14 agrochemical firms of causing grievous harm to her and others by selling Agent Orange to the American military.

title: Sicily divers seek final missing people in shipwreck after Lynch's body found
summary: The body of UK tech tycoon Mike Lynch was recovered on August 22 from his sunken yacht off Sicily, as the search continued for the last of the six people missing.

title: Juice probe takes selfie while flying by Moon
summary: The space probe benefited from the double gravitational assistance of the Earth and Moon, which it photographed in this world premiere.

title: China and Belarus to sign trade agreement
summary: Belarus, which has been hit by Western sanctions over its support for Russia's offensive in Ukraine, said it will sign a free trade deal with China for services and investment.

title: One of the world's largest diamonds found in Botswana
summary: The diamond – a rough 2,492-carat stone – was found in the Karowe Diamond Mine in northeastern Botswana, Lucara Diamond Corp. said in a statement.

title: French prosecutors request trial in Depardieu rape probe
summary: The actor is accused of two rapes by Charlotte Arnould. A judge will now decide whether a trial will be held.

title: At Pernod Ricard, 'the group's interests come first'
summary: 'Successions season III' (5/6). The pastis company created by Paul Ricard in 1932, which became the Pernod Ricard group in 1975, the world's number 2 in wines and spirits, is still run by a Ricard family member. He is determined, whatever the cost, not to repeat the mishaps of the first handover between Paul and his son Bernard in 1968.

title: Nepal lifts TikTok ban after nine months
summary: The ban was lifted after TikTok agreed to follow Neapl's regulations.

title: Venezuela's Supreme Court certifies Maduro's claims he won presidential election
summary: The high court is packed with Maduro loyalists said voting tallies published online showing he lost by a landslide were forged.

title: Nestlé CEO Mark Schneider to step down after eight years at helm
summary: Nestlé said in a statement Schneider 'has decided to relinquish his roles as CEO and member of the Board of Directors.'

title: How Kamala Harris got a makeover at the Democratic convention
summary: Avoiding appearing as an outgoing Biden administration figure, the vice president is presenting herself in a new, more modern and energetic light to the American people.

title: Doug Emhoff, Kamala Harris' 'Second Gentleman,' charms the Democratic convention with his self-deprecation
summary: The 59-year-old lawyer fulfilled his mission by sharing anecdotes about meeting his wife, their mixed-race marriage with different religions and their blended family.

title: Canada rail freight shutdown threatens to disrupt economy
summary: Amid a labor dispute, Canada's two rail operators shut operations on Thursday, locking out nearly 10,000 workers. It is the first time the country has faced simultaneous work stoppages at the two companies, which in the past have negotiated labor deals in alternate years.
